text:
Hello!
I'm migrating from <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-php> to <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-php> does someone has done this before, is there any guide on how to do it?

Does anyone have an example of X-HubSpot-Signature validation for CRM Cards in Node js?
When tried with webhook API the it's work for me. But, when tried for CRM Cards requested I can not validate X-HubSpot-Signature

Hi everyone! o/

Anybody know if there’s an endpoint where I can get the answers to a forms?
I know there’s an <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/forms|endpoint to list all forms> created, but I couldn’t find one to retrieve the answers…
Hi Isabela, can you please be a bit more specific about what you mean by answers?
I mean who responded to the forms and what they answered
you can see the form submissions in "Marketing -Lead-Capture ( or someting similar (at the bottom) then Forms"
then choose the Form you like
is it on the same endpoint?
it is inside of the app
but is there a way to access it through the API?
No i dont think so
Why, what would be the Use-case?
i’m developing and integration (like zapier or so), and I’d like to use this as a trigger… like “everytime someone answers a form, do (…)”
i think you can use the Webhooks inside of your app for that
private/public app
hmmm, nice idea! I’ll check if they have a webhook for this!
thanks Andreas! o/

Hello all. Is it possible to get - via the API - what channel of an inbox an email was sent to. So if I have three email addresses connected to an inbox, for example. Preferrably I'd also like to use this as a conditional in a workflow, but api would be an ok solution.
If I remember correctly, the value should always be a string.

So it depends on how you setup your zapier, if you set it up with a private app token then it will count to it's own rate limit (per private app token). If you set it up with oauth then it's on a different rate limit <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/webhooks/validating-requests> which version are you using?

Hey <@U01QVR44MEY> 
We didn't specify any API or private app when we started using it.
We just picked the account from zapier, so not sure how it is communicating to the CRM
Yep so that's just communicating via OAuth, and so it's on it's own rate limit
You’re right, that is how the documentation shows values being formatted. Unfortunately sending it as a string still gets called a Bad Request.
Looks like the issue was `createdate` whereas HubSpot requires `hs_createdate`
(Note that `createdate` is acceptable for sorting)
any update here?

Can you please share the console logs that you found?
 <@U0122AC0PCN>

Hi everyone, I have a client that wants to integration DEAR ERP system with HubSpot. (Product library/ inventory data from Dear to HubSpot, and Customer data from HubSpot to DEAR) There is a native connector, but the scope would require something smarter. Please reach out to me if you can help build this out for us.
I have sent a private message please check thanks
